message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

The paper discusses the use of restricted Boltzmann machines (RBM) for modeling high-dimensional multinomial observations, specifically in natural language processing applications where words are modeled by K-ary discrete distributions. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CL (Computation and Language), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). However, given that the paper focuses on training RBMs on word observations and using the learned features for tasks such as chunking and sentiment classification, cs.LG and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories.
